definition: to explode or burst/to quick fry or quick boil
nature/character/property/quality/attribute/sexuality/sex/gender/suffix forming adjective from verb/suffix forming noun from adjective, corresponding to -ness or -ity/essence/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: When parents and children are temperamental opposites, the results can be explosive.
sentences.chinese: 当家长与孩子们脾气相反时，其结果可能是爆炸性的。

sentences.english: Metal delivers the explosive roar of US high-gain metal sound.
sentences.chinese: 模拟爆炸性的美制高增益金属音。

sentences.english: At the same time, size and complexity of the network increase explosively.
sentences.chinese: 与此同时，网络的规模和复杂性出现了爆炸性的增长。

sentences.english: The non-explosive 22-pound bomb fell into the foundation, cutting off electricity.
sentences.chinese: 这颗22磅重的非爆炸性炸弹砸进地面，切断了电源。

sentences.english: I can look out the window and see the explosive growth.
sentences.chinese: 我看出窗外就可以看到爆炸性的增长。
可能生成爆炸性过氧化物。

sentences.english: He suggests a new era of explosive activity in this area is just beginning.
sentences.chinese: 他提示在这方面出现爆炸性活动的新时期才刚刚开始。

sentences.english: The explosive mixture in a rocket consists of both a fuel and a supply of oxygen.
sentences.chinese: 火箭中的爆炸性混合物由燃料和氧气构成。

sentences.english: Pound was of exploding power in his literary creation.
sentences.chinese: Pound的文学创作充满了爆炸性的力量。

sentences.english: Phytoplankton can grow explosively over a few days or weeks.
sentences.chinese: 浮游植物的数量可以在数天或数周内爆炸性增长。

sentences.english: There are several reasons for this explosive growth.
sentences.chinese: 一些原因促成了这种爆炸性增长。

sentences.english: Can be used in IIA, IIB groups explosive atmosphere.
Yet the number of Christians continues to grow explosively.
sentences.chinese: 然而基督徒的人数却持续有爆炸性地成长。

sentences.english: There are a lot of sensational nes stories in today's newspaper.
sentences.chinese: 今天的报纸有很多爆炸性新闻。

sentences.english: This permitted a burst of entrepreneurial activity and an explosion in productivity growth.
sentences.chinese: 这带来了创业活动的迸发和生产率的爆炸性增长。

sentences.english: Drop an explosive dragon's tooth on your enemy, 20 second recharge.
sentences.chinese: 向你的敌人扔下一只爆炸性的龙牙，20秒回复。

definition: to cause to burn/to ignite/to detonate/a fuse
to explode or burst/to quick fry or quick boil
